questions.question: James doesn’t like cricket. …………………….
questions.description: Negative additions to negative remarks are made with nor/neither + auxiliary + subject.

questions.question: I was late for the meeting. ………………………….
questions.description: Affirmative additions to affirmative remarks are made with so + auxiliary + subject.

questions.question: She passed the test and …………………………. did I.
questions.description: Affirmative additions to affirmative remarks are made with so + auxiliary + subject.

questions.question: I have finished my job and …………………………. has he.
questions.description: Affirmative additions to affirmative remarks are made with so + auxiliary + subject.

questions.question: Susie didn’t arrive. ……………………….. did Mary.
questions.description: Negative additions to negative remarks are made with nor/neither + auxiliary + subject.

questions.question: He didn’t buy it. ……………………………. did I.
I can play chess ………………………… he can’t.
questions.description: Negative additions to affirmative remarks are made with but + subject + auxiliary + n’t.

questions.question: She knows how to swim, but ………………………..
My husband doesn’t watch movies …………………………… I do.
questions.description: Negative additions to affirmative remarks are made with but + subject + auxiliary + n’t.

questions.question: She didn’t complain. Neither …………………………… her husband.
questions.description: The same auxiliary is used in both statements.

questions.question: I know you don’t like me. I don’t like you ……………………….
questions.description: Don't either means the same as neither.
